meanings.definition: To move or tend to move toward a center of gravity or other attractive force.
meanings.sent1: The planets gravitate towards the sun due to its strong gravitational pull.
meanings.sent2: I always seem to gravitate towards the park when I need some fresh air.
meanings.sent3: The cookies on the counter seem to gravitate towards my hand whenever I walk by.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes naturally gravitate towards the beautiful sunset in the distance.
meanings.sent5: The students gravitate towards the teacher, eager to learn from her.

meanings.definition: To be drawn or attracted to something.
meanings.sent1: Children often gravitate towards colorful toys in the store.
meanings.sent2: I tend to gravitate towards mystery novels when choosing a book to read.
meanings.sent3: The cat seems to gravitate towards the warm spot by the fireplace every evening.
meanings.sent4: His attention always gravitates towards the latest gadgets in the electronics store.
meanings.sent5: The butterflies gravitate towards the blooming flowers in the garden.
